FILE - In this April 22, 2014 file photo, a man uses his phone near an Apple store in Beijing.

Apple shares closed Tuesday at $114.64 - down 14 percent since hitting a record $133.60 in February.

That puts Apple in a "correction," which is Wall Street jargon for price declines of 10 percent or more from a peak.

Apple Watch will be sold at some Best Buy stores
entry.summary:
Best Buy, which has more than 1,000 stores in the U.S., says it's the first national retailer to sell the watch outside of Apple Inc.'s stores.

Apple unveiled the watch in September and began taking orders in April.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores from August
entry.summary:
The Apple Watch and Apple Watch Sport models will be sold at more than 300 Best Buy stores in time for the holiday shopping season, a spokeswoman for Apple Inc said.

"Customers love Apple Watch, and we are thrilled to begin offering it at Best Buy," she said in an email.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores from August
entry.summary: (Reuters) - The Apple Watch will be available at stores of Best Buy Co Inc (BBY.N), the largest U.S. consumer electronics chain, starting Aug. 7.

entry.title: Apple Watch to be sold at Best Buy stores in August
entry.summary:
Best Buy is the first retailer to sell the watch outside of the Apple retail store.

"The Apple Watch is an important addition to an emerging product category, and we know our customers want it," Jason Bonfig, senior category officer, said on the Best Buy website.

entry.title: Technology shares lead a slump in US stocks; Apple sinks
entry.summary: "Apple is the biggest publicly traded company in the world, so it's going to have a big impact on the indices," noted Erik Davidson, chief investment officer at Wells Fargo Private Bank.

entry.title: Technology shares lead a slump in US stocks; Apple sinks
entry.summary: The major stock indexes declined from the get-go as traders reacted to weaker showings late Tuesday from Microsoft, Yahoo and Apple.

entry.title: Technology shares lead a slump in US stocks; Apple sinks
entry.summary:
"Do iPhone sales tell us a lot about the broader economy and the markets or does it tell us more about Apple? It probably tells us more about Apple," Davidson said.

APPLE WORRIES: Apple slumped 4.5 percent a day after the company gave a cautious outlook for the current quarter and didn't provide much detail on how its new smartwatch was doing.

entry.title: Technology shares lead a slump in US stocks; Apple sinks
entry.summary:
Weak showings from Apple, Microsoft and other companies pulled stocks lower in afternoon trading Wednesday, pointing the market toward its second decline in as many days.

THE QUOTE: As the biggest publicly traded company in the world, Apple has a big impact on the market.

entry.title: Apple's $62B hit is bad…but it's not the worst
entry.summary:
Despite beating earnings estimates on Tuesday evening, Apple's stock has sunk in after-hours trading and is on course to write a new page in the history books.

It also briefly fell below its 200-day moving average Tuesday and Apple hasn't closed below this metric since Sept.

In January 2013, Apple lost a remarkable $59 billion in market cap, meaning Tuesday's after-hours fall set an unwarranted milestone.

Correction: An earlier version misstated when Apple's stock fell below its 200-day moving average.

NOT JUST APPLE: There was also disappointment that Microsoft booked an $8.4 billion charge related to the write-off of the Nokia phone business it bought just over a year ago.

entry.title: Time will tell if Apple Watch catches on, as Apple fans wait
Many Apple fans wait on buying Apple Watch, as early buyers seek improvements
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - For all those who hailed the iPhone as the "Jesus Phone" in 2007, the Apple Watch's arrival has hardly been the second coming.

Early Apple Watch owners seem generally happy with it, but Apple's bigger worry should be those on the sidelines - even hardcore Apple fans, not to mention the rest of us - who are waiting to take the plunge.

Apple Watch also doesn't always provide the right information at the right time.

entry.title: Time will tell if Apple Watch catches on, as Apple fans wait
entry.summary: That's not to say the Apple Watch is a bomb.

entry.title: Apple reports record earnings for recent quarter
entry.summary: "We had an amazing quarter, with iPhone revenue up 59 percent over last year, strong sales of Mac, all-time record revenue from services, driven by the App Store, and a great start for Apple Watch," Cook said.

entry.title: Apple gives weak forecast, shares fall nearly 7 percent
entry.summary: Apple said on Tuesday it sold 47.5 million iPhones in the third quarter, up 35 percent from a year ago.

entry.title: Strong iPhone sales; Apple stock down with few Watch details
Apple earnings rise on strong iPhone sales but impact of watch remains unclear
entry.summary: In one tantalizing clue, Apple reported $2.6 billion in revenue from the segment that includes the watch and several other products, or about $952 million more than the previous quarter, when the watch had not yet gone on sale.

entry.title: iPhone sales strong, but Apple watch sales still a mystery
entry.summary:
While not releasing specific figures for the Apple Watch, Apple reported total results for several products, including the watch, that suggest sales were lower than many Wall Street analysts expected.

Apple also forecast that revenue for the quarter ending in September will fall between $49 billion and $51 billion US, indicating total sales could fall below Wall Street estimates of $50.8 billion US.

For the latest quarter, Apple said revenue from all sources grew 33 per cent from last year to $49.6 billion US in the April-June quarter, with the iPhone contributing $31.4 billion US in sales.

That beat the estimates of Wall Street analysts surveyed by FactSet, who were expecting Apple to report earnings of $1.81 per share on sales of $49.25 billion US.

Apple got a big boost from new markets like China, which contributed more than a quarter of the company's revenue, or $13.2 billion US.

entry.title: Apple Reports 38% Rise in Profit as iPhone Sales Surge
entry.summary: Apple also reported $2.6 billion in revenue for a category it calls "Other Products."

entry.title: Apple says App Store, other services resume after three hours

entry.title: Apple has cash cow in iPhone even as phone industry slows
entry.summary:
Apple has said it won't release sales figures for the new Apple Watch, though some analysts believe demand has fallen since Apple introduced the wearable gadget three months ago.

Most experts say iPhone sales will get another bump when Apple releases new models this fall.

entry.title: Apple has cash cow in iPhone even as phone industry slows

entry.title: Apple Faces Class Action Suit Over Bag Searches
entry.summary:
An Apple representative declined to comment.

Lawsuits from within Apple's ranks are rare.

One worker, whose name was blacked out of a court filing, told Cook in a 2012 message that Apple managers "are required to treat 'valued' employees as criminals."

Apple had argued in court filings that the case was not suitable for class action status because not all store managers conducted bag searches, and any searches that did occur took a tiny amount of time which don't deserve compensation.

entry.title: Review: Apple Music has everything, perhaps too much
entry.summary: But Apple Music feels like an attempt to take on every competitive app from Pandora to Spotify to YouTube and advance the idea of online radio at the same time.

entry.title: Review: Apple Music has everything, perhaps too much
entry.summary:
Apple's new music service is a valiant effort to catch up in the emerging business of offering unlimited music on demand for a monthly price.

- Apple Music is also a giant song recommendation machine.

In fact, if Apple Music had only these two features, I'd feel satisfied.

A new Music app replaces Apple's online radio service, iTunes Radio.

entry.title: Review: Apple Music has everything, perhaps too much
iPod updated by Apple - why?

entry.title: Apple's updates iPod Touch amid declining sales
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Although the iPod's popularity has waned, Apple is updating its music player for the first time in nearly three years by giving the flagship Touch model a faster processor and better cameras.

As demand has slowed, so has Apple's updates to the iPod: Apple no longer updates its iPods annually as it usually does with its top sellers.

entry.title: Apple's updates iPod Touch amid declining sales
Apple updates iPods for first time in 3 years
entry.summary: Apple also gave all of its iPods new colors -- blue, pink, silver, gold and space gray.

entry.title: Apple Updates iPod Touch
Apple's iPod Touch update brings faster chip, better cameras
entry.summary: Beyond music, the iPod Touch might get new customers hooked on Apple's apps, video and other content - such that they'll turn to an iPhone, iPad or Mac when they are ready to buy a device that does more.

entry.title: Apple releases surprise iPod Touch refresh
entry.summary:
The new Touch has a faster processor and better cameras, plus a software update that enables Apple Music, a $10-a-month service that offers unlimited playback of millions of songs.

The iPod was Apple's first successful foray beyond personal computers.

entry.title: Apple refreshes iPod Touch with faster processor, better cameras, Apple Music service
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - Apple is refreshing its iPod Touch music player for the first time in nearly three years, as the company seeks to make music a central part of its devices once again.

Apple Music launched June 30 as music fans increasingly embrace subscriptions over pay-per-song services such as Apple's industry-leading iTunes.

The last hold-out, Barclays, confirmed on Tuesday its debit card users and Barclaycard credit card customers will be able to use Apple Pay in the future.

entry.title: Why Apple Music is worth every cent
FTC exploring Apple rules for streaming music rivals in App Store
entry.summary:
Apple recently launched a new music streaming service, Apple Music.

Apple takes a 30 percent cut of all in-app purchases for digital goods, such as music streaming subscriptions and games, sold on its platform.

A spokeswoman for Apple declined to comment.

Apple has long been a leader in digital music through its iTunes Store, but it has been a relatively late entrant to on-demand streaming.

Streaming services' chief grievances with Apple stem from the company's 30 percent cut.
